name: In Other Words 5 Quiz | Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Select the correct words to complete this sentence.
Mum let me ______ my favourite ______ for breakfast.
questions.explanation:
choose, cereal.

	'Choose' in this sentence means to select, and 'cereal' is an edible grain (wheat, oats, barley, etc).

questions.text: Jacob had to ______ for his ______ on the slide.
questions.explanation:
wait, turn.

	'Wait' in this sentence means to be delayed, and 'turn' means opportunity.

questions.text: It was ______ this ______ so mum put on her ______.
questions.explanation:
chilly, morning, wrap.

	'Chilly' means cold, 'morning' is the part of the day before noon, and 'wrap' is a woman's dressing gown.

questions.text: My brother ______ me how to ______ a boat.
questions.explanation:
taught, row.

	'Taught' in this sentence means to teach, and 'row' is the means of propelling the boat.

Four, four, eight.

	'Four' is the number 4, and 'eight' the number 8.

questions.text: I wanted ______ cake, and asked mum for another ______.
questions.explanation:
more, piece.

	'More' means another piece, and 'piece' is part of a whole (cake).

questions.text: You should ______ dad ______ when he pays his ______.
questions.explanation:
hear, moan, tax.

	'Hear' in this sentence means to listen. 'Moan' means to grumble, and 'tax' is money paid to the government.

questions.text: Look! Can ______ see the ______ grazing by the ______ tree?
questions.explanation:
you, ewe, yew.

	'You' means yourself, 'ewe' is a female sheep and 'yew' is a type of tree.

questions.text: Dad asked me to ______ the ______ while he put up the tent.
questions.explanation:
hold, pole.

	'Hold' in this sentence means to grip, and 'pole' is a long round piece of wood or metal.

questions.text: Jill went to collect water, but there was a ______ in the ______.
questions.explanation:
leak, pail.

	'Leak' means a crack or hole through which water can escape, and a 'pail' is a type of bucket.
